title: Strictly pros Johannes Radebe and Graziano Di Prima to 'perform same-sex duet'
text:
Johannes and Graziano will perform together on Strictly next month (Picture: Getty)

Strictly Come Dancing professionals are set to perform a same-sex dance routine on the show next month, according to reports.

Johannes Radebe, 32, and Graziano Di Prima, 25, will apparently perform a ‘romantic number’ together on the show to Emeli Sande track Shine on Sunday 3 November.

Speaking to The Sun, a backstage source said: ‘It’s a brave move for the Beeb and will break boundaries but bosses are under a lot of pressure.’

They added: ‘It will hopefully pave the way for a same-sex couple next year. It’s a step in the right direction for making the show even more diverse.’

Metro.co.uk has reached out to the BBC for comment.

Graziano doesn’t have a celebrity partner this year, while Johannes is paired up with actress Catherine Tyldesley on the current series.

This wouldn’t be the first time Strictly has featured same-sex pairings, with Neil Jones and Kevin Clifton, Gorka Marquez and AJ Pritchard, and Katya Jones and Nadiya Bychkova, all having previously danced together in a group dance last year.

Strictly has faced increased pressure to have a same-sex celebrity and professional pairing on the show, with the BBC recently explaining how they’re ‘completely open’ to the idea.

‘Strictly Come Dancing is an inclusive show and we are proud to have featured same sex dancing amongst the professional dancers in group numbers in previous series,’ a BBC spokesperson said.

‘We are completely open to the prospect of including same-sex pairings between our celebrities and professional dancers in the future, should the opportunity arise.’

The show is facing more pressure after it was revealed Ian Watkins, aka ‘H’ from Steps, will be partnered up with professional skater Matt Evers on rival show Dancing On Ice.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday BBC One at 6.40pm.
